member.name: WS_TRANSFER_MODE
member.summary: Whether messages that are sent or received are streamed or buffered.

summary.para: Setting this flag means messages are delivered in chunks. The start of the message (opening tag, headers, and opening body tag) will be returned to the application when completes. It is up to the application to call before reading each chunk of the message body. The end of the message (closing body and envelope tags) will be read when is called.
Not setting this flag means the entire message is read and buffered in memory before indicates completion.

Setting this flag means messages are transmitted in chunks. The start of the message (opening envelope tag, headers, and opening body tag) will be transmitted when is called. It is up to the application to call after writing each chunk of the message body to cause the chunk to be transmitted. Any remaining body data will be transmitted when is called, along with the end of the message (closing body and envelope tags).
Not setting this flag means the entire message is buffered in memory and is only transmitted once is called.
Messages that are written or read are buffered.
This is equivalent to specifying neither norWS_STREAMED_OUTPUT_TRANSFER_MODE.
Messages that are written or read are streamed.
This is equivalent to specifying both andWS_STREAMED_OUTPUT_TRANSFER_MODE.
